alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Frederick; Howard; Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 12:31PM EDT until May 27 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CARROLL COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND...NORTHWESTERN HOWARD...NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES IN CENTRAL MARYLAND AND EAST CENTRAL FREDERICK COUNTIES IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... At 1230 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Taneytown to 7 miles northeast of Mount Airy to near Damascus, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Westminster, Eldersburg, Mount Airy, Taneytown, New Windsor, Laytonsville, Winfield, Lisbon, Glenwood, Watersville, Linwood, Poplar Springs, Roxbury Mills, Uniontown, Woodbine, Wagners Mill and Marston. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central and north central Maryland. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
